Qworum ontology

An RDF ontology for use within the Qworum platform and the larger RDF ecosystem.

Table of content

  1. Qworum class interfaces
  2. Qworum classes
  3. Various terms

Qworum class interfaces

Description of the interfaces that Qworum classes implement. Interfaces can extend zero, one, or many other interfaces.

Here is the Turtle file containing this qrmi RDF vocabulary, and the graphical description of the qrmi vocabulary is depicted below.

Qworum classes

Description of Qworum classes. A Qworum class implements exactly one interface. For their properties and method parameters, Qworum classes can indicate which actual interface implementations they are using.

Here is the Turtle file containing the qrmc RDF vocabulary, and the graphical description of the qrmc vocabulary is depicted below.

Various terms

A vocabulary that is useful for defining other vocabularies and for RDF in general, such as:

  • An end-of-document indicator, used for ensuring the completeness of RDF documents that are being read, particularly in streaming scenarios.

Here is the Turtle file containing the qrmv RDF vocabulary, and the graphical description of the qrmv vocabulary is depicted below.
